entry.value:
La Región Madre de Dios se localizaen la zona sur oriental del territorio peruano, entre los paralelos 9º 55´ 33”y 13º 20´ 04”, latitud sur, y los meridianos 68º 39´ 27” y 77º 22’ 27”,longitud oeste. Su ubicación se considera estratégica por constituir una regiónbifronteriza con los países de Brasil y Bolivia.

Tiene unasuperficie de 85,182 km² equivalentes a 8’518,200 hectáreas, que representa el6.6% del territorio nacional y el 15.3% de la selva. En cuanto al área porprovincias, se reporta para Tambopata el 42.58% de la superficie departamental,para Manu el 32.54% y para Tahuamanu el 24.88%.

Se halla cubierta mayoritariamente por bosques subtropicales donde serealizan diversas actividades productivas, destacando entre ellas lasextractivas de oro, madera y castañas. Recientemente y con gran futuro haincursionado en el ecoturismo.

Durante toda su historia ha afrontado el restrictivo problema de lafalta de vías de comunicación, lo cual la ha aislado del resto del país,mermando así el desarrollo de su potencial económico.

La región está dotada con un gran potencial en recursos naturales, alpunto de ser considerada la “capital peruana de la biodiversidad”. Existen tresimportantes áreas protegidas: el Parque Nacional del Manu, el Parque NacionalBahuaja-Sonene y la Reserva Nacional de Tambopata.
entry.editor-value:
The Madre de Dios Region is located in the south-eastern part of the Peruvian territory, between parallels 9º 55'33 "and 13º 20' 04", south latitude, and meridians 68º 39'27 "and 77º 22 '27", west longitude . Its location is considered strategic because it constitutes a frontier region with the countries of Brazil and Bolivia.

It has a surface area of ​​85,182 square kilometers equivalent to 8,518,200 hectares, representing 6.6% of the national territory and 15.3% of the forest. Provinces in Madre de Dios include Tambopata (42.58% of the departmental area), Manu (32.54%) and Tahuamanu (24.88%).

It is mainly covered by subtropical forests where various productive activities are carried out, including the extraction of gold, wood and chestnuts. Recently the region has invested in ecotourism.

Throughout its history it has faced the restrictive problem of a lack of  communication and transportation infrastructure, which has isolated it from the rest of the country and limited economic development.

The region is endowed with a great potential in natural resources, and is considered the "Peruvian capital of the biodiversity". There are three important protected areas: the Manu National Park, the Bahuaja-Sonene National Park and the Tambopata National Reserve.

entry.editor-value:
Ordinance 02/2014 - Establishing the Regional Environmental Authority of Madre de Dios State. Then, this regulation was derogated and nowadays the Gerencia General de Recursos Naturales y Gestión del Medio Ambiente leads the implementation of public policies, strategies, programs and plans in the area of territorial planning, sustainable management of natural resources, conservation of biodiversity and protection of the environment.

Ordinance 05/2010 - Regional Climate Change Strategy Commision

The Climate Change Strategy for Madre de Dios has not been approved yet. Since 2010 Madre de Dios state had a commission for its develop.
Ministerial Resolution 0301/2010- 

Transfers functions of forest management to the regional government of Madre de Dios.
Madre de Dios' ZEE was developed in 2009 and formalized through Ordinance 032-2009.  The zoning map can be found here.
Madre de Dios has formed a Climate Change Commission and drafted a strategy, but the strategy has not been formalized.

Madre de Dios' Regional Council includes nine Ordinary Commissions which were formed by Regional Council Agreement No. 003-2016-RMDD / CR.  The two commissions related to forestry and land use include:

AGRARIAN , ENVIRONMENT, AMAZON AND NATIVE COMMUNITIES COMMISSION.

COMMISSION ON ENERGY, MINES AND HYDROCARBONS

Key Regional Directorates include:

Regional Production Director

Responsible for organizing, planning, conducting, coordinating, evaluating, Supervision, control and fulfillment of the functions in fisheries and industry established in Articles 52 and 54 of Law No. 27867 Regional Government, as amended by Law No. 27902.

Regional Directorate of Forestry and Wildlife

responsible for the administration and coordination of the activities and activities of the State and for the protection of the natural environment and the protection of the natural environment and the conservation of the natural environment.

Regional Directorate on Agriculture

responsible for organizing, planning, conducting, coordinating, evaluating, supervising , Control and fulfillment of functions in agrarian matters established in Article 51 of Law No. 27867 Organic Law of Regional Governments, as amended by Law No. 27902.

1. Illegal mining (Illegal and informal activities)
2.  Agriculture and livestock expansion
3. Communication/transportation infrastructure, energy and extractive industries
